sentences.english: Madame Defarge was one of the leading spirits of the Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 迪法热夫人是这场革命的主要人物之一。

sentences.english: The idea of bringing revolution to the countryside had turned out to be a fantasy.
sentences.chinese: 改造农村的革命理想成了虚妄的幻想。

sentences.english: The sacred place of the revolution invites a good many visitors.
sentences.chinese: 革命圣地吸引着许许多多的参观者。

sentences.english: Driven by the new technology revolution, economic globalization has picked up speed.
sentences.chinese: 在新技术革命的推动下，经济全球化进程加快。

sentences.english: Yuan Shikai quickly seized the fruits of the victory of the 1911 Revolution.
sentences.chinese: 袁世凯迅速篡夺了辛亥革命的胜利果实。
分光镜之于化学的革命。

sentences.english: Passion alone cannot win the revolution; Passion just makes martyrs.
sentences.chinese: 光靠满腔热血，不会使革命成，只能制造烈士。

sentences.english: Constructivism is a revolution of contemporary educational psychology.
sentences.chinese: 建构主义是当代教育心理学的一场革命。

sentences.english: How did you think about"Luxe Pack in Green" area?
sentences.chinese: 您认为“奢侈品包装的绿色革命”特区的展示如何？

sentences.english: Innovative application of advanced technology makes possible many of the P600's new features.
sentences.chinese: 先进技术革命性的应用使P600具有许多新的特性。

sentences.english: By the revolutionary impact of white deer before the case was originally a typical legal society.
sentences.chinese: 受到革命冲击之前的白鹿原是典型的宗法制社会。

sentences.english: So here's to the impending revolution in biology. Come Darwin's 300th anniversary there will be even more to celebrate.
sentences.chinese: 所以，我们预祝即将来临的生物学革命。当达尔文诞生
这项发明革命性地推动了眼科学的发展。

sentences.english: The revolution lasted till 1794 and the King Luis XVI was sentenced to death.
sentences.chinese: 这场革命持续到1794年，国王路易十六被判死刑。

sentences.english: Four post-election trials have been held at Branch 15 of the Revolutionary Court in Tehran.
sentences.chinese: 选举后有四个审判是在德黑兰革命法庭第15科举行。

sentences.english: This revolutionary historical novel centres in the Autumn Harvest Uprising.
sentences.chinese: 这部革命历史小说以秋收起义为中心内容。

definition: democratic revolution/bourgeois revolution (in Marx-Leninist theory, a prelude to the proletarian revolution)
second revolution/campaign from 1913 of the provisional revolutionary government (under Sun Yat-sen and the Guomindang) against Yuan Shikai 袁世凱|袁世凯 and the Northern Warlords
